intro: Medicago sativa subsp. kandagharokabulica, commonly known as the Kandahar clover, is a perennial legume native to Central Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with a deep green color and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. It has a deep root system that helps in soil stabilization and nutrient fixation. This subspecies is valued for its forage quality and ecological benefits in degraded lands.
